caption: They serve big portions and for reasonable prices. very welcoming owner. Keep it up.
Great food! Great service!  Too die for desserts!

I had placed an order through door dash , not only the restaurant had the food delivered 2 hours late , but send the wrong items The food was cold , they didn’t have some of the items  I had ordered , never apologized, the  food was tasteless and ended up in the trash . The salad was a Greek salad , not an Italian salad ! If I want Greek I go to a Greek restaurant not Italian Anyway anyone thinking about this place , make sure you really want to go there , personally, there will never have my business as I said , food and service Horrible !!!!

I randomly found this place on Caviar and decided to order. I got a pizza and a spaghetti. The value is amazing! I didn't get the right pizza, but the pizza I did receive was still amazing! Probably some of the freshest, most flavorful pizza I've ever had.  The spaghetti (I upcharged to get meatballs) was a large portion and so delicious. I was expecting basic, but the sauce and the garlic and basil just made the entire dish. The meatballs are totally worth the money. I will order from here again!
4.5 In house better than carry out but still good. Loved the white pizzas, Alfredo with mushrooms & peas, and Appetizers. Caesar was basic so not sure why it’s raved about but it was fresh.

ABSURD!!! I placed an order for delivery. I waited over and hour and when I called they said the food was being packed. TWO hours later they canceled my order and said the restaurant is closed WHEN IT’S OPEN RIGHT NOW! Terrible service!!
Great food!!!
Always a delicious experience and an incredibly warm feeling... like being received into family’s home. For more than a decade this has been a top family favorite!

My daughter loves the garlic bread and pasta. The fettuccine carbonara is awesome. I've liked everything I've ever ordered there. And the staff is always so warm and friendly. // Did some takeout recently. All amazing even after the drive from Bethesda to Germantown

Phenomenal food, awesome drinks, great staff, inexpensive for the location and quality of food.  One of the best family owned Italian restaurants around.  I like to eat and do not write reviews often, but last night's veal shank was amazing.  I've been coming here for years from VA and always leave happy.  Worth the drive.

WOW.  What can I say about this lovely, family owned restaurant: IT FEELS LIKE HOME.  So much so that whether my mom and I feel like celebrating or in need of a mood boost, THIS is where we go.  The energy is awesome.  You feel the love of a traditional, home-made experience, but with a garnish of elegance and a flare for gourmet excellence.  THE OWNERS AND FOUNDERS ARE STILL IN THE KITCHEN COOKING EACH MEAL,  to this day.  Most recently, we had LITERALLY the best meal we have had in a while.  Very Covid conscious, we felt well protected and very comfortable with the sanitization practices.  BUT THE FOOD....OH THE FOOD. So I think we ordered literally almost 2 items per section on the menu - yep it was our 2nd meal out since March so...  We started with the grilled pumpkin salad made my the lady  of the house: Incroyable! (French for incredible).  Then the most amazing pasta dish I have had in years I believe (since I visited Italy in 2008): THE PUMPKIN RAVIOLI.  I literally had everyone looking at me - I think my sounds of appreciation were a bit disturbing - ha! We both had the same entree: The red snapper fillet with sauteed veggies in a white wine and caper sauce -  magnificent and enough for 2 meals.  The wine was an incredible Italian made from organic grapes, this was after the negronis from the bar, the drink was perfect - I drank it way too fast. To show their appreciation for our visit, the kitchen sent us a dessert sample platter made fresh by the chef himself - I have to tell you at this point I was lost in some sort of food trance -  I just couldn't believe how delicious every SINGLE dish was.  Here we had a flan (yes, flan - but not sweet and sugary, the perfect balance of ingredients), and a freshly made almond cake.  WELL THEN.   This experience stayed with me for weeks on end.  This made up for all the COVID misery off not being able to enjoy a delectable meal once in a while.  THANK YOU!!!
One of my go-to spots to grab some food. good location, well organised, and great customer service. Very good job!
Long wait time for pick up
This has easily been some of the best Italian food I've had in a long time.  Super friendly staff and atmosphere.  Well definitely be going back soon
Went on vacation and didn't turn off Uber Eats. Didn't really help me solve the situation either.
We always order from Sorrento. Their sausage and peppers appetizer is OUTSTANDING! Reminds me of my Italian grandmothers recipe. Authentic Italian food with AMAZING service!
Excellent service and even better food.
A wonderful Italian restaurant in Bethesda!
their prosciutto pizza slapped like a mf. 11/10 will order again :)
What a great restaurant! Great food, atmosphere and outstanding service! Definitely stop by and treat yourself, your special someone, your family and friends! Can’t wait to stop by again!
Date night - one of our favorite restaurants. Try the homemade pasta; it's simply divine. The food is delicious, the service is warm and friendly, and the ambiance is great.

Family owned classic Italian trattoria! Everything you could ever want: pizza, homemade pasta, excellent fresh fish and if you can't leave to for dessert because you are too much garlic bread, make sure you bring home the tiramisu, a cannoli or biscotti.

We had a very enjoyable meal here last night. Love the ambiance, reminded us of our honeymoon in Italy. Really great service, I believe it was the owner or manager who came out to talk to us about the wine list. Speaking of which, they have a great selection of Italian wines at various price points. They have a large selection of pasta dishes, many of the pastas themselves are homemade. And lots of sauce options as well. We both enjoyed our meals (manicotti for my wife, tortellini for me). Will certainly be back to sample more of their menu.

Atmosphere brings you to Italy.  Their daily specials are imaginable.   Their homemade pastas and desserts are delicious. Melinda showcases the Italian warmth in their Restaurant.   She ensures your wonderful experience!  We had the most beautiful experience.
The food was excellent & the service was first rate.
Good food, nice selection of pastas. Reasonable prices. I liked it

Nice Italian place next to a public garage - so parking is not a problem. The restaurant conquered the heart of this reviewer by serving a lemon peel with their espresso. Also, since the Negroni turned 100 years the week I went, I had to have one, and it was delicious. For the main course, I had pizza, and it was OK. The crust was too thick for my liking and lacked flavor. The wait staff was friendly but refused to do individual checks for our large group, even though we told him ahead of time.
The food is DELICIOUS. The only thing better than the food is how nice and welcoming the staff is. Truly a family owned restaurant that treats you as family too.
Great food 🥘 . Deserving of five stars ⭐️! I ordered Fetuccini Monte Carlo 🍝. It was great 👅.
Bad service and disappointing pasta. We were embarrassed for our guests
I love everything they make! Another old school family run Bethesda Italian institution! The pizza, the antipasti and every entree is delicious.
Fun night of Opera singers and very reasonable food. BIG portions. Delicious.
Excelent food. They cook from scratch so you have to wait but is worth it.

We had a  lovely meal that couldn’t even be ruined by a mixed up GrubHub delivery! The pasta was spectacular and the tiramisu was scrumptious! Had the pleasure of speaking with Melinda in regard to a mixed up delivery and she was so  accommodating and   Willing to do whatever was necessary to ensure that our dinner was beyond our expectations. Can’t wait until we have a chance to visit the restaurant in person! Thank you again Trattoria Sorrento!
Food and service were excellent

Great food, lackluster service. We spent more time waiting for menus and the check than we did actually eating. If it wasn't for our eventual frantic arm waving I doubt we would ever have gotten our check. It wasn't even particularly busy that night (only half full), nor were we at some hard to see table (we were second row from the kitchen). Service took so long we had to cancel plans afterwards.
Great food and friendly service!
Always a delicious meal and wonderful service. Terrific homemade pastas.

We came here per a recommendation from a local shop that its a great family owned place with great food. Definitely not.  There was no host so we waited a few minutes to be seated (I should know by now to leave at this point, but the recommendation...) So we wait and the busser finally greets us and takes us to a table.  They advertise 50% wine by bottle on Wednesday with the little stipulation of under $50 a bottle, of course anything decent is above. The waitress was incredible pushy and demanding the entire time, I had to tell her three times we decided we didn't want wine.  Then I ask her about two dishes, and she says she'd recommend the $40 lobster special... Ok, I didn't even ask about that but no thanks. I'll need a minute to think about my meal. She comes back and again pushes the lobster (why I didn't leave now I don't know) So we order chicken parm and the crab capers and olive pasta dish.  First off every pasta dish has a surcharge of meat. The chicken parm wasn't breaded and it lacked any flavor, we ended up taking it home and throwing it away. The crab was dry and lacked flavor, of course the capers added flavor to the dish because they're capers.... But nothing about it was any better than a pasta mista dish at $9.99  So with a rude server and overpriced bland food I'd never recommend or come back here.

Excellent classic Italian meal, and very reasonably priced for DC/Bethesda!  I had the linguini with clams, and it was good; the red pepper flakes (and the heat that accompanied them) were a little unexpected.  My wife's chicken marsala, however, melted in my mouth and was exceptional.  They also made a decent negroni.
Awesome authentic, Italian, mom & pop restaurant with great food, decor, and staff!
Excellent food preparation and presentation .  Family owned restaurant with some of the best food and service you can get in Bethesda
Good food lots of different options. Very accommodating with customer that have allergies.
Pretty decent Italian food at a reasonable price.  They have a bright atrium section that is quite good for lunch time.  Service was good.
Amazing authentic food, and phenomenal service!

This used to be our go-to place for Italian. We stopped in this weekend and it was just like coming home. Family owned, super accommodating, great classic Italian food. Delicious not fussy, great for vegetarians!
Sorrento is family owned. Authentic Italian  cooking at the best price in Bethesda. Atmosphere  is casual perfect for singles, couples, and family
The service and food were both phenomenal!!!

OMG did this place make me realize how much I miss GOOD Italian food.  the food was awesome and was all fresh and homemade, customized to our every wish.   we ate there on a Sunday night (while on vacation) and plan to go back again.   the place can easily be described as a more hole In the wall that locals know.  I'd come back in a heartbeat ands recommend to all.
Lamb chops/ribs/whatever were fire.  But the bread needed olive oil.
Pasta, drinks, appetizers all excellent!
Nice restaurant, good food, risotto and sangria a little bit too pricey.
Had a lovely dinner - Trattoria Sorrento has always been a favorite of ours! So consistently amazing- the food esp. seafood for me as well as the warm & welcoming atmosphere. We love it!

Me and my husband ate here at around 9:45 pm. Our server was welcoming and kind.  He provided us with excellent service and gave us a little history of the restaurant that has been there since 1991. The food was delicious and the portion sizes were quite large.  We will be back!
Outstanding dinner!
Very delicious food! Kid friendly, authentic Italian, the best calamari in the entire area!!!

Had lasagna. Was so different. Looks like ravioli so had to ask waitress. She confirmed that it is lasagna. Interesting. Pretty good. My wife had penne pasta with spinach, chicken and smoked mozzarella in Alfredo sauce. Unfortunately she didn’t like it. Waitress gladly exchanged it for a spaghetti w meatball and it was good. She rated her dish at 3.5 out of 5. Other had manicotti stuffed and was good.
Very good Italian
Fantastic! My family and I had an excellent dinner. A hospitable family business serving authentic Italian recipes. My wife and I decided to make it our go-to restaurant for date night.

(Translated by Google) You really eat Italian. I tried some restaurants that presented themselves as restaurants. Where Italian was cooked but not true! Here I was able to taste the Sorrento cuisine. Very good and the house wine: delicious. Great service too! I recommend you try! (From an Apulian couple.)  (Original) Si mangia veramente Italiano.Ho provato alcuni ristoranti che SI presentavano come rist. Dove si cucinava italiano ma non Vero! Qui ho potuto assaporare la cucina sorrentina.molto molto buona e il vino Della casa: delizioso. Anche il  servizio ottimo! Vi consiglio di provare! ( Da una coppia pugliese.)
Decent food and quiet on a weeknight.
Trattoria Sorrento is fantastic! I LOVE this place! Way better than The Pines of Rome (yuck!). Trattoria Sorrento has wonderful food, great prices and friendly staff.

Terrible service. Average food. We got there at 6:45 on a Saturday night. We were seated right away. Our dinner companions were not there yet, but we got soup. It was not especially good. Our friends came but no one came to take our order. Finally asked someone and then a man came to take our order. Then came back with our original server. It was 7:30. Our food didn’t come til 8:15. When it came, it was just ok. My lasagna tasted liked a cardboard box. We wanted dessert, but again, when we asked, nobody came with any dessert menus. After a 20minute wait , we paid and left. Not a great evening

A gem in the heart of Bethesda! We were embraced like honored  guests this wonderful Italian family's dining room.  Homemade pasta and fresh seafood to satisfy the most discriminating palate. Must try the beet salad.
Great food, atmosphere, and the owner is awesome!
Great authentic Italian fare in downtown Bethesda. I had the seafood risotto, which was fantastic. My wife had the pasta puttanesca with crab meat- delicious as well.
Very expensive even for the average italian dish. For the price, I ecpected to be delighted. I wasn't even amazed.
Excellent authentic atmosphere service and food! ❤
Always great authentic Italian!👍
Good food, broad menu, relaxed atmosphere, and generous servings at a reasonable price.   A long-time Bethesda favorite for a reason!
Always a wonderful meal and great service
Best Italian restaurant in Bethesda in my opinion.   Try the Cappelini Cardinale....delicious!
Average food. Way overpriced for the quality. Muscle were sandy, pasta was bland and pizza uncooked. Not coming here again.
Great authentic Italian food!
Wonderful food, helpful service.
(Translated by Google) Excellent service and exquisite menu.  (Original) Excelente atención y exquisito menú .

A solid choice for a nice dinner in Bethesda.  Great service, fresh ingredients, good food. The salads were perfect (one was peach and another was beet).  I thought the pasta and sauce were very good.  Pacing of the meal was slow, so you won't feel rushed.  Nice staff and the owner stopped by the table.  Highly recommended.
My dad's favorite Italian restaurant. Fresh ingredients and home cooked meals. Great food!
Service was slow, but food was great.

Bland and disappointing.  It's hard to image puttanesca, the classic Italian pasta dish, as absolutely lacking in the rich flavor of the ingredients, including black olives, capers and garlic.  But such is puttanesca at Sorrento. Our starter beet salad was soaked in a dressing with too much vinegar. Nothing at Sorrento reflects quality. Let's just say that Sorrento is not a memorable Italian restaurant that we would recommend.  Far from it.
The best
Delicious food and sangria! Each of our dishes came out piping out and full of flavor. The coconut gelato was the perfect dessert!

this is some legit italian food.  Stopped here more out of convenience than anything else and it turned out to be pretty fantastic.  Excellent pasta (seemed homemade).  Great little atmosphere - reminded me of the little restaurants in italy that I saw on a trip a few years ago.
The food was really excellent but service left something to be desired.  Recommend the spiedini alla Romano if you have never tried it theirs is delicious (don't be afraid of the use of anchovy).
Very good authentic home made Italian dishes. Simple atmosphere, good seating availability, parking next door, very reasonably priced, excellent for a family dinner.
Authentic Italian restaurant in Bethesda. The food is good and the service is excellent!
The fish was nice.  So was the white pizza.  Better than the pasta.
Place is great.  Meat ravioli weas out of this world just the way my Nona used to make it. Props to this restaurant.

I'm from the NYC/NJ area and I am always looking for authentic Italian now that I live in Maryland. I ordered the Rigatoni with Alfredo, Goat Cheese, and Bacon and it was fantastic. Pasta was perfectly cooked and the sauce was a really good consistency. I thought the place was reasonably priced and the dining room was at a comfortable volume. I would recommend this place to someone who wants an authentic italian dish and a relaxing environment. I would return to this restaurant.
LOVED the food! The staff at this family-run restaurant - warm and delightful. It was the best Italian food I have ever had. I can't wait to go back!

My family is proud of our Italian heritage. This is a place that makes that part of us proud as well. The grilled calamari and the veal ravioli are amazing. They have a fantastic wine selection and it's a perfect date setting. The owners are a family and the atmosphere represents their kindness and caring for the Italian food craft. I will continue to go there and am very happy that I got introduced to this hidden treasure.

Family owned & operated, very friendly, always aims to please & aim is true. Delicious food, well prepared and served by wait staff that are family or very good friends and have an interest in your satisfaction. We have been coming for close to twenty years and never leave disappointed. Directly adjacent to a public parking garage. We had their rack of lamb last night and left only bare bones. Fine wine list as well. Kudos to Sorrento

Food and decor are about what you'd expect for Bethesda: decent and showing its age. Not great, not too run down, somewhere between. Service is pleasant and patient with large groups. Food is average but it's a good place to bring both infants and elderly as you'll be able to dine without too much fuss (or disturbing your neighbors).
Had a great experience. Took my mother in law for mothers day to the restaurant with her family and they all loved it. I would definitely recommend it to other people.

Sorrento is overpriced for what it is.  Went there recently and sampled several dishes. Mussel appetizer was OK, and came in a fairly decent tomato sauce. Calamari was decent. Grilled chicken Alfredo was bland, and the chicken Ceaser salad was just OK. I did order an Irish coffee, and I have to say, it was darn fine. One of the best liqueur coffees I've had in a while. I believe they used a fresh whipped cream, which makes a great deal of difference.  The coffee, alas, was not enough to rescue the rest of the meal from mediocrity. And frankly, at the rates they're charging I can point out some places that will offer better grub. Our waitress was a tad slow too.
